clinical_study.brief_title: Study on the Incidence of Intussusception (IS) in Children Aged < 12 Months in Japan
clinical_study.official_title: Observational Database Study on the Incidence of Intussusception in Children Aged < 12 Months in Japan

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to analyse baseline data on IS in order to monitor the possibility of increased risk of IS in children aged <12 months after introduction of the Rotarix vaccination in Japan.

primary_outcome.measure: Occurrence of IS in subjects aged < 12 months
Occurrence of age-specific and gender-specific incidence of IS among subjects aged < 12 months in Japan

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of IS cases hospitalized more than once among subjects aged < 12 months.
Occurrence of IS cases by calendar months and year among subjects aged < 12 months

arm_group.description: Children aged < 12 months presenting with IS and covered by the Japan Medical Data Centre Company Limited (JMDC), Tokyo referred to as the JMDC Medical Data Bank (JMDC-MDB).

intervention.description: Data source will be the Japan Medical Data Centre Company Limited (JMDC) - JMDC Medical Data Bank (JMDC-MDB) database. Aggregated data (age in months and years and gender) for all subjects recorded in the database and subject-level data for IS cases will be extracted from the database. This database will be reviewed to extract data for the period between January 2005 and April 2011. Cases of IS will be identified using the International Classification of Diseases-10 (ICD-10) diagnostic codes, examination codes and procedural codes.

study_pop.textblock: Children aged <12 months presenting with IS and covered by the JMDC-MDB database from January 2005 to April 2011.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- A male or female infant aged < 12 months at the time of IS diagnosis and affiliated to the JMDC-MDB database.
- An IS case should be identified as per the ICD-10 diagnostic code-K56.1 (any-field listed), examination codes, and procedural codes.
